alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 3:32AM PST until March 01 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...Until Noon today. * IMPACTS...Above 12.0 feet, minor flooding of low lying dairy and pasture land north and east of Tillamook can be expected, particularly during high tides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 13.5 feet and appears to be at or near maximum crest height. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM PST Tuesday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage around noon Tuesday and continue falling to around 7.0 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at Noon PST.
